author: Richard Bao
text: There’s always something up with Vestiaire Collective that they just can’t seem to get it right. Last week I received an email saying that I needed to update my banking information as per their new payment system which would shorten the time that the sellers need to wait before getting paid, how nice! Well, I did it right away and then sold my bag and was told that my payment would go through today on feb 24th. Well then at literally 3am this morning I got an email saying that “oh no we can’t pay you, you also need to verify your identity and your address by uploading your passport pic and your utility bill” - I did it right away but was feeling extremely annoyed because why couldn’t you ask me to do all of these last week when I was asked to verify my banking information?????? How convenient it is that on the day that I am supposed to get paid I was asked to provide additional documents which could take up to FOUR business days to be verified according to VC??? I’ll remove this review if VC indeed ends up verifying my identity and paying me today! Otherwise it’s just a scam - holding my funds longer than necessary. Honestly I would not use VC if I wasn’t living in Europe. Before I moved to Europe, I was using the RealReal, must faster, much more intuitive and more quality buyers who would not back out on deals. I would switch to another platform as soon as there is a better one coming out in Europe. On VC it’s full of garbage buyers who make offers and don’t go through with the payment after - what ends up happening is as a seller toh are tide up in that offer for more than 24 hours without being able to void the offer or get out. Please also fix that and make buyers put down a deposit before they can start making offers. The user interface also sucks, laggy as hell. If you are in North America, stick to the RealReal, don’t waste your time on VC.
title: There’s always something wrong in the VC land

author: Ashleigh Brown
text:
I sold a scarf on Vestiaire and used their prepaid postage to mail it from my local post office.  They claimed to have never received it, and never informed me/sent a notification that the sale did not go through because they never received the scarf.  The scarf was never returned to me, so with no notification from Vestiaire, I assumed that the sale went through.  When I realized that I still hadn't received payment months later, I made a formal complaint.  But their customer service representative said they'd only consider a refund if I composed a HANDWRITTEN LETTER OF HONOUR to explain the situation.  Then I had to take a photo of it and forward it to their customer service.  The customer service rep then said they couldn't reimburse me because my request was outside the limitation time, and refused to pay me the value of the scarf.  The scarf was under £200 which is nothing for a company of this size.  Vestiaire, if you're going to create a secure postage system, maybe pay for better class postage or tracking, or be ready to pay your customers when things get lost.  Not to mention for the 20% fee you charge, you should do better.  

Oh, and when I tried to explain to a new customer that I was removing my items from Vestiaire as we were in a dispute, they deleted my comment (because they review everything you say so that it only benefits them).  So yeah, I'm done with these people.
title: Vestiaire lost my item and refuse to reimburse me

author: George Giurickovic
text:

I've purchased a coat from one of their seller, they sold it at a size 50 resulted to be much shorter.
I paid the extra to have the item checked for quality and it resulted in the coat  being considered a "great bargain" and only missing a little button, so I proceeded with the purchase and have it shipped (after an incredibly long wait), then I noticed instantly it was much smaller than its described size, so I asked what could I do and they wrote me that the only way was to sell it again (note that I had to discount it as well).

In my country this is called a fraud

author: Yulia
text:
This review is to beware other sellers of what Vestiaire Collective can do to you.
After my sale I sent them an item which was found to be non-compliant. Fine, these things happen to the best of us sometimes and I was planning to send this item to the original brand for investigation as there are many events described here when authentic items were declared non-compliant, even those which were previously bought through VC.
I paid the processing and postage fee so that the item could be shipped back to me. After it arrived in my country, I received a message from DHL that my shipment has outstanding tax to be paid. This is clearly nonsense as this was MY ITEM which was returned back to me which meant Vestiaire Collective did a false customs declaration which incurred tax charges which by law I am not obliged to pay as I am receiving an item back which belongs to me.
I contacted VC support for clarification and fixing of this issue. The responses I received from CS were the following:
- "we can't pay shipping for you" (nonsense, I paid the shipping cost)
- "we can't pay the tax as the shipment is not insured" (no comments on this)
No one even tried to understand the actual problem until someone from chat support wrote that yes, this is clearly VC's mistake, asked me to pay the tax and promised to reimburse me.
I paid the tax (over 50 bucks ON MY OWN ITEM) and sent it to VC.After a few days I received a message saying that reimbursement is not possible and "they hope I understand". No, I don't.
I tried to contact DHL to get a refund for the tax since I've got all the proof that the shipment was a return. DHL representative informed me that I was lucky I paid the tax in time to get my item back because the shipper - Vestiaire Collective - INFORMED THEM TO DESTROY THE SHIPMENT when they tried to contact them to clarify the customs declaration issue. Again, VS kept insisting they did not give such an instruction despite the fact that I showed them a screenshot from that particular email from DHL. When I asked whether they are implying DHL is lying, no one responded to me.

Having said that, I would like to summarize:
1) customer support does not even try to understand the issue. They don't even answer the question you are asking, very often their response does not even correspond to what you've asked.
2) feeding false information, taking back their own promises which were set in writing.
3) failing to take responsibility for their screw ups.
Shame.
title: Sell at your own risk.

Something is very wrong with this company.
